intro: Iozoste acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed iozoste, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be considered invasive in some areas.
